intro: Senecio matatini subsp. matatini, commonly known as the Matatini groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It is a low-growing perennial herb with narrow, linear leaves and small yellow flowers arranged in clusters. The plant belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
